quizzes.question: What attributes does the frameset tag require to indicate its size?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <frame> Tag[/h1]

A page can be divided into frames using a special frame document.  

The [b]<frame>[/b] tag defines one specific window (frame) within a [b]<frameset>[/b]. Each <frame> in a <frameset> can have different attributes, such as border, scrolling, the ability to resize, etc. 

The <frameset> element specifies the number of columns or rows in the frameset, as well as what percentage or number of pixels of space each of them occupies. [code format="html"]<[b]frameset[/b] [b]cols[/b]="100, 25%, *"><[b]/frameset[/b]>
<[b]frameset rows[/b]="100, 25%, *"><[b]/frameset[/b]>[/code]
[note]The <frameset> tag is not supported in HTML5.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which attribute prevents a frame from resizing?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Working with Frames[/h1]

Use the [b]<noresize>[/b] attribute to specify that a user cannot resize a <frame> element: [code format="html"]<frame [b]noresize[/b]="[b]noresize[/b]">[/code]
Frame content should be defined using the [b]src [/b]attribute.

Lastly, the [b]<noframes>[/b] element provides a way for browsers that do not support frames to view the page. The element can contain an alternative page, complete with a body tag and any other elements. [code format="html"]<frameset cols="25%,50%,25%">
   <frame src="a.htm" />
   <frame src="b.htm" />
   <frame src="c.htm" />
   <noframes>Frames not supported!</noframes>
</frameset>[/code]
[note]The <frame> tag is not supported in HTML5.[/note]
